articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Congratulates  Afghan President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Congratulates  Afghan President
Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Tuesday sent a congratulatory message to Hamid Karzai upon his reelection as President of Afghanistan.
					Extending congratulations to Karzai upon his reelection as President of Afghanistan, Kim in the message wished him success in his work.

articles.title: End to Blockade against Cuba Called for
articles.content:
End to Blockade against Cuba Called for
 Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- A DPRK delegate, addressing the plenary meeting of the 64th UN General Assembly on Oct. 28, said that the U.S. unilateral economic, trade and financial blockade against Cuba has lasted for half a century, adding that this blockade imposed by the U.S. under the pretext of "accelerating the democratic transition" of Cuba is aimed to bring down the social system chosen by the Cuban government and people.
					 Noting that this is a wanton violation of the principles of respect for sovereignty of states, territorial integrity and non-interference in other's internal affairs stipulated in the UN Charter and international laws, he continued:
					
					 The U.S. blockade against Cuba is a silent economic war against the Cuban people as well as an illegal and inhuman criminal act which has no validity from the political, legal and moral points of view.
					
					 Entirely unjustifiable and intolerable are extraterritorial and unilateral coercive measures taken to impose political, economic and social systems upon others on the basis of a specified country's view on value to attain one's sinister political purpose.
					
					 It is the consistent stand of the DPRK government to oppose all forms of interference, threat of use of force and sanctions against sovereign states.
					
					 The DPRK delegation strongly urges the U.S. to put an unconditional and immediate end to its unilateral economic, trade and financial blockade against Cuba in line with all relevant resolutions adopted at the UN General Assembly and make compensation to Cuba for all economic losses suffered by it so far.
					
					 The delegation voices full support to the adoption of a resolution on putting an end to the blockade against Cuba submitted to the meeting and extends firm support and solidarity to the Cuban government and people in their just cause of defending the country's sovereignty and achieving economic development and social progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Preview of "A Day of Training"
articles.content:
Preview of "A Day of Training"
 Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- A feature film "A Day of Training" was produced by the April 25 Film Studio of the DPRK.
					 The film gives vivid artistic depiction of how soldiers display the spirit of devotedly defending the leader and the spirit of protecting the homeland holding arms during the days of preparing themselves for battle through the scenes of servicepersons of the Korean People's Army decorating an ordinary day of training with profound loyalty and feat.
					
					 The preview of the film took place at the Taedongmun Cinema House on Wednesday.
					
					 Appreciating the film were senior state officials, the chairpersons of the friendly parties, officials of party and power organs, ministries and national institutions and creators, artistes, reporters and editors in the fields of culture and art and media and officials in Pyongyang City.

articles.title: Double Gold Medalist in IMO
articles.content:
Double Gold Medalist in IMO
 Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- The DPRK has produced many students with brilliant mathematical talent.
					 Among them is Ri Un Song of Pyongyang Secondary School No. 1 who bagged gold medals two times running in the 49th IMO for 2008 and 50th IMO for 2009 held in Germany in July.
					
					 He attracted the attention of people for his good results in the national mathematical contest.
					
					 From the childhood he was called a student with many questions by his teachers. When a teacher taught one thing, he raised many questions on the related matter.
					
					 In the course of raising questions and solving them, his mathematical ability has improved considerably.
					
					 He likes composition and reading and is good at physical culture. It is his hope to become a competent scientist.

articles.title: Life of Revolutionary Shining with Revolutionary Faith and Will
articles.content:
Life of Revolutionary Shining with Revolutionary Faith and Will
 Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- Today marks the 104th birth anniversary of indomitable revolutionary fighter Kim Hyong Gwon.
					 Born into a patriotic and revolutionary family from generation to generation, he grew into an ardent patriot and revolutionary under the education of the members of the Mangyongdae revolutionary family.
					
					 Being a core member of the Young Communist League of Korea and the first party organization formed by President Kim Il Sung, he rallied masses closely around the President by awakening and organizing them through experienced work and led them to positively turn out to the struggle for the independent development of the Korean revolution.
					
					 He mixed himself with workers, peasants and people of other strata to bring home the President's Juche-oriented revolutionary line and strategic and tactical policies to them and conducted vigorous activities to expand and strengthen the anti-Japanese revolutionary forces in the broad Korean and alien areas with Mt. Paektu as the centre.
					
					 He frequented rural villages in the guise of a doctor or peasant to make league officials expand the revolutionary organizations and organized art performance, dissemination of songs, gathering for expressing impressions on a book and the like to infuse the masses with the revolutionary consciousness and vigorously arouse them to the anti-Japanese struggle.
					
					 After the formation of the Korean Revolutionary Army by the President, he carried out with devotion the struggle for acquiring weapons upholding the President's line on armed struggle and, on the other hand, educated members of the Korean Independence Army who had been under the nationalist influence so that they embarked on the road of revolution.
					
					 His unshakable revolutionary conviction and will were further displayed in the days of struggle behind bars.
					
					 He was arrested by the enemies owing to a renegade's secret information against him. Though he was a prisoner behind bars, he waged a valiant struggle in jail with the indomitable will that a revolutionary must fight against the enemies to the last without stopping the struggle for the national liberation even a moment.
					
					 When the Japanese imperialists sentenced him to a jail term of 15 years in a gangster-like trial, he was not disappointed in the least but converted trial court into a place for condemning the crimes of the aggressors.
					
					 In last moments of his life, he earnestly called for waging an armed struggle to liberate the country.
					
					 The life of the indomitable revolutionary fighter Kim Hyong Gwon, who dedicated his precious youth to the struggle for the victory of the revolution with firm conviction in sure victory and unswerving spirit, will shine long in the history of the country.

articles.title: KCNA Slashes U.S. Human Rights Racket
articles.content:
KCNA Slashes U.S. Human Rights Racket
Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- The U.S. and other hostile forces are making much ado about the so-called "human rights issue" in the DPRK at the UN General Assembly.
					 This is nothing but a despicable plot to attain their sinister purposes by putting political pressure upon the DPRK.
					
					 It is the political common sense universally accepted by the international community that the U.S. and its followers' "human rights" racket is so ridiculous that no one would lend an ear to it as they are becoming evermore undisguised in politicizing human rights issues and applying selectivity and double standards in handling them. 
					
					 Those countries that are becoming most vociferous about "human rights issues" are the countries with the most serious human rights records without an exception. 
					
					 To take the U.S. as an example, the rich get ever richer and the poor ever poorer and the number of the unemployed and the poor is on the steady increase; the right of equality, the right to work and the right to existence, elementary rights of human being, are being ruthlessly violated.
					
					 The average income ratio between the monopoly capitalists and the working people in the 1970s was 40:1 and it increased as high as 367:1 and the number of the poor reached 39.8 million last year or an increase of 2.5 million over 2007. 
					
					 The "anti-terror war" started by the U.S. is internationally branded as a war for violating human rights and usurping state power. Angry voices critical of this war of genocide are heard from the United States, too, as it took dozens of times more lives of innocent civilians than those killed in the "September 11 incident." 
					
					 Japan is taking the lead in echoing the U.S. trumpeting about "human rights". Japan, too, wantonly abused the rights of a countless number of Asians in the past but has not yet settled the crimes, earning an ill fame as a spiritually and morally despicable country bereft of even the face to speak about human rights.
					
					 The ceaseless mean "human rights rackets" kicked up by the U.S. and its followers against those independent countries after selectively choosing them as their targets while feigning ignorance of their hideous human rights abuses are aimed at keeping the outdated order of strong-arm actions and arbitrary practices in the international arena. They seek to attain unlimited freedom to interfere in others' internal affairs under the spurious signboard of "championing human rights."
					
					 Such a hegemonic attempt should never be tolerated.
					
					 Free medical care and free education, etc. enforced in the DPRK, the best socialist state in the world as it is centered on the popular masses, are unimaginable in the above-said countries. It is the height of sarcasm that those countries are talking about what they call "human rights issue" in the DPRK.
					
					 The people of the DPRK enjoy a genuine life and happiness as human beings something unimaginable in the capitalist society where a human being is treated as a slave of money.
					
					 Under our socialism the popular masses, the driving force of the history, are considered as the most powerful and dignified beings and everybody enjoys a worthwhile and joyful life, working hard for the prosperity of the country.
					
					 The people of the DPRK are dashing ahead toward a thriving socialist nation undeterred by the world-wide economic crisis thanks to the Juche idea centered on man and the invincible socialist system, its embodiment, as they guarantee the dignity and rights of the people on the highest level.
					
					 The U.S. and other hostile forces should not have even the slightest calculation that the people of the DPRK would allow themselves to open the door to their "human rights offensive" and abandon the principle.
					
					 Noisy trumpeting about "human rights issue" by the countries with the worst human rights records would only bring disgrace to them.

articles.title: West's Accusation against DPRK over "Human Rights Issue" Refuted
articles.content:
West's Accusation against DPRK over "Human Rights Issue" Refuted
 Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- Unsavory forces of the West pulled up the DPRK over what they called "human rights issue" at a meeting of the 3rd Committee of the 64th UN General Assembly.
					 The U.S. and Japan, in particular, were reported to have slandered the DPRK by linking the "human rights issue" with the issue of improving the relations with it.
					
					 Minju Joson Wednesday observes in a signed commentary in this regard:
					
					 We do not know what is the West's conception of human rights. But such "human rights issue" touted by the West has never existed in the DPRK and it cannot exist here. 
					
					 Under the socialist system in the DPRK, everything in the society serves the interests of the people and state activities are oriented to fully meet their requirements for independence as it was chosen by themselves, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 What matters is what real aim the above-said forces of the West are seeking through their "human rights offensive" against the DPRK.
					
					 They seek to apply the "human rights" strategy in a bid to realize their sinister scenario to tarnish the image of the DPRK in the international arena and stifle it.
					
					 The U.S. strategy for sanctions and military threat and blackmail to isolate and suffocate the DPRK economically and stifle it militarily is proving futile.
					
					 For this reason, they pin hope on the "human rights" strategy like a drowning man trying to catch a straw.
					
					 If the unsavory forces of the West are truly interested in the solution to the "human rights issue", they had better frankly open their human rights abuses to the public and face a judgment by the international community instead of wasting energy and time in taking issue with others.
					
					 Particularly serious are the human rights abuses of Japan.
					
					 Japan would be well advised to think twice about its miserable position in which it is fated to stand international trial for human rights abuses. 
					
					 Its attempt to do harm to the DPRK through such long-bankrupt "human rights offensive" is as foolish an act as trying to sweep the sea with a broom.

articles.title: U.S. Accused of Pulling Up DPRK over Its Religious Issue
articles.content:
U.S. Accused of Pulling Up DPRK over Its Religious Issue
 Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- The U.S. Department of State in a recent annual report on international religious freedom singled out eight countries including the DPRK as "the countries of special concern." It deliberately took issue with the religious situation in various countries, behaving as if it were "a religious judge."
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday observes in a signed commentary carried in this regard:
					
					 The groundless accusation made by the U.S. against the DPRK over what it called "religious issue" was nothing but a politically motivated grave provocation to it.
					
					 Religionists are leading a free pious life, exercising inviolable rights as citizens free from any discrimination under Korean-style socialist system centered on the popular masses.
					
					 Members of international religious organizations, religious bodies and believers from different countries witnessed this reality and favored and recognized the Korean religionists' life of faith during their visits to the DPRK.
					
					The U.S. provoked a war of aggression in Korea in the 1950s and indiscriminately bombed more than 1,900 churches and temples, destroying all of them and mercilessly killing hundreds of thousands of innocent believers.
					
					 The U.S. reactionary ruling quarters are taking issue with the religious views and beliefs, which criticize the decadent American way of life and refuse to introduce it. Moreover, they are persecuting, arresting and killing those religionists displeased with their reactionary politics.
					
					 It is the U.S. that brutally suppresses and murders not only American religionists but also foreign religionists. 
					
					 The U.S. talks a lot about "the religious issue" in the DPRK not because of any sincere interest in the pious life of the religionists but because of its criminal scenario to tarnish the image of the DPRK under the pretext of the above-said issue and realize its wild ambition to isolate and stifle the DPRK. It is foolish and reckless for the U.S. to try to do harm to the dignified DPRK through false propaganda. 
					
					 The U.S. had better settle its serious religious problems before pulling up other countries over non-existent "religious issues."

articles.title: All Koreans Called upon to Hold Banner of Independent Reunification
articles.content:
All Koreans Called upon to Hold Banner of Independent Reunification
 Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) --The people's desire for national independence and sovereignty is bound to be trampled down and no social progress can be expected under any foreign domination and subjugation, says Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in a signed article. 
					 It goes on: 
					
					 Only when the south Korean people turn out in a nationwide struggle against outside forces' domination and interference and traitors to the nation can they seek a way out and improve the inter-Korean relations and achieve national reunification.
					
					 It is prerequisite to putting an end to the tragedy of the national split and achieving the sovereignty and independence of the nation throughout Korea to force the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces out of south Korea.
					
					 Whoever has the soul of the Korean nation and aspires after reunification should come out in a just struggle for national reconciliation and unity and the country's reunification, be he or she in the north or in the south or overseas.
					
					 The June 15 North-South Joint Declaration and the October 4 declaration are the banners all the Koreans should hold high in the on-going struggle for independent reunification against outside forces.
					
					 It is necessary to give momentum to the atmosphere of supporting, defending and sincerely implementing the inter-Korean declarations wherever Koreans live and bring about a landmark phase in improving the inter-Korean relations and achieving independent reunification.
					
					 The great unity of the whole nation based on the idea of "By our nation itself" provides a sure guarantee for a victory in the struggle for independent reunification against outside forces.
					
					 It is quite possible to bring earlier the day of accomplishing the cause of independent reunification when all the members of the nation desirous of national reconciliation and unity and reunification unite close, guided by the idea of "By our nation itself" irrespective of differing ideology, system, political view and religious belief and courageously turn out in the just struggle for achieving independent reunification against foreign forces.

articles.title: U.S.-S. Korea Joint War Exercises Censured
articles.content:
U.S.-S. Korea Joint War Exercises Censured
 Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- Recently the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces and the warmongers of the south Korean army staged north-targeted "Hoguk" (homeland defence) joint war exercises in the land, sea and air, according to a military source.
					 These war exercises for aggression that last for nearly 10 days from Oct. 29 reportedly involved the operation commands of the three services of the south Korean forces and their fleets and flying corps and huge naval and air forces and combat equipment of the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces in south Korea and overseas.
					
					 The armed groups of the south Korean forces deployed in areas of Kangwon Province, Kyonggi Province and Seoul of south Korea are busy with madcap combined exercises for repulsing "intrusion," river-crossing attack and mobile operation drills. 
					
					 Mine sweepers, dock-landing craft and guided missile destroyers of the navy of the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces and landing craft and combat ships of the south Korean navy staged naval battle, submarine battle and mine sweeping maneuvers and landing operation drills under the simulated conditions of an actual battle with the waters of the East and West Seas as operational theatres. 
					
					 Overseas-based strategic bombers, fighter bombers and pursuit-assault planes of the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces are busy with exercises for striking major targets, providing close air support, taking-off and landing on emergency airstrips and carrying out long-distance navigation and air raids in a coordinated operation with flying corps of the U.S. 7th air force stationed in south Korea and the south Korean air force.
					
					 Earlier, the U.S. imperialist bellicose forces staged provocative joint war maneuvers in the air and sea in a coordinated operation with fleets of the south Korean navy after bringing even the flotilla of the super-large nuclear powered carrier "George Washington" to the waters of the West Sea of Korea. 
					
					 All facts go to patently prove that threat to the Korean Peninsula is not caused by somebody's "nuclear issue" but by the north-targeted war exercises of the U.S. imperialists and the warmongers of the south Korean army and their invariable hostile policy towards the DPRK.

articles.title: Story about Crust of Overcooked Rice
articles.content:
Story about Crust of Overcooked Rice
 Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung came to his residence late on a summer evening of Juche 35 (1946) together with an official who was in charge of the construction of Kim Il Sung University to discuss the project with him.
					 A woman informed anti-Japanese heroine Kim Jong Suk of the fact that President Kim Il Sung came with a guest.
					
					 Kim Jong Suk said in a low voice that for the heated discussion of work, the President didn't inform her of his coming with the guest; she prepared the table regardless of her evening meal and entered the room carrying the table with her.
					
					 When the woman said with tearful eyes that she would skip her evening meal again, Kim Jong Suk replied with a smile that there was the crust of overcooked rice, adding that she would like to prepare tables ten times a day for those who were devoting themselves to the efforts for the construction of the country, true to the leadership of the President.
					
					 At that time there was nothing special in the residence compared with the people's life.
					
					 Not a day passed without preparing the table for the visitors to the residence. So she was often to eat the crust of overcooked rice for her meal as she prepared the meals for the visitors with the rice rationed like ordinary people.

articles.title: Delegado coreano demanda poner fin al bloqueo anticubano de EE.UU.
articles.content:
Delegado coreano demanda poner fin al bloqueo anticubano de EE.UU.
Pyongyang, 4 de noviembre (ATCC) -- Al intervenir el 28 de octubre en el pleno del 64o periodo de sesiones de la Asamblea General de la ONU, el delegado de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea condeno el bloqueo unilateral de Estados Unidos contra Cuba en los planos economico, comercial y financiero, el cual dura ya 50 anos.
					  Este embargo, que se impone bajo el pretexto de "acelerar la transicion democratica" de Cuba, persigue el objetivo de derrocar el regimen social escogido por el gobierno y el pueblo de Cuba, revelo el y continuo:
					
					  Esto deviene un grave acto de violacion a los principios estipulados en la Carta de la ONU y las leyes internacionales: el respeto a la soberania, la integridad territorial y la no intervencion en los asuntos internos.
					
					  El bloqueo anticubano deviene la guerra economica silenciosa contra el pueblo cubano y un acto criminal ilegal e inhumano que no tiene ninguna razon desde los puntos de vista politico, juridico y moral.
					
					  No pueden ser justificadas ni permitidas en ningun caso las extraterritoriales y unilaterales medidas coercitivas para forzar a otros el regimen politico, economico y social segun la concepcion de valor de cierto pais persiguiendo malsanos propositos politicos.
					
					  Es invariable la posicion del gobierno de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea de oponerse a toda clase de intervenciones, la amenaza con las fuerzas y la sancion contra los Estados soberanos.
					
					  La delegacion coreana urge fuertemente a EE.UU. poner fin de manera incondicional e inmediata al unilateral bloqueo economico, comercial y financiero contra Cuba cumpliendo todas las resoluciones correspondientes de la Asamblea General de la ONU y recompensar todas las perdidas economicas sufridas hasta la fecha por el pais caribeno como su consecuencia. 
					
					  Aprovechando esta ocasion, apoyamos totalmente la aprobacion del proyecto de la resolucion sobre el fin del bloqueo anticubano, que fue planteado en la presente Asamblea General, y enviamos nuestro firme apoyo y solidaridad a la justa causa del gobierno y el pueblo de Cuba por defender la soberania  del pais y lograr el desarrollo economico, el progreso social y la prosperidad.

articles.title: Minju Joson niega la acusacion del Occidente en problema de DDHH
articles.content:
Minju Joson niega la acusacion del Occidente en problema de DDHH
Pyongyang, 4 de noviembre (ATCC) -- Se conocio que durante la reunion del tercer comite del 64o periodo de sesiones de la Asamblea General de la ONU, las fuerzas malsanas del Occidente se atrevieron a dar lecciones a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea hablando del supuesto "problema de DDHH" de esta.
					  En particular, Estados Unidos y Japon relacionaron ese asunto con el mejoramiento de sus relaciones con la RPDC.
					
					  Al respecto, el rotativo Minju Joson publico en su edicion de este miercoles un comentario individual que sigue:
					
					Aqui no se sabe a ciencia cierta la concepcion de DDHH del Occidente.
					
					Pero no hay ni puede haber el "problema de DDHH" que cuestionan de una manera u otra los paises occidentales. 
					
					  El regimen socialista de Corea fue escogido por las mismas masas populares.
					
					  Por lo tanto, todas las cosas de la sociedad sirven para los intereses de las masas populares y las actividades del Estado estan orientadas a las labores para satisfacer la demanda independiente de ellas.
					
					Entonces, cual es el verdadero objeto con que las fuerzas malsanas occidentales libran la "ofensiva de DDHH" contra la RPDC?
					
					  Es que ellas pretenden aplicar la estrategia de "DDHH" para denigrar la imagen de la RPDC en la arena internacional y realizar su malsana ambicion de aplastarla.
					
					   Ultimamente, se dan al traste la sancion y la estrategia de amenaza y chantaje militares de EE.UU. para aislar y asfixiar economicamente a la RPDC y aplastarla por via militar.
					
					  Por eso, a ellas no les quedaban otro remedio que depositar la esperanza en la estrategia de "DDHH".
					
					  Si las fuerzas malsanas occidentales estan interesadas de veras en la solucion del "problema de derechos humanos", deben revelar primero sus defectos y someterse al juicio de la sociedad internacional, en lugar de malgastar los esfuerzos y el tiempo para censurar a otros.
					
					  En particular, le convendria a Japon meditar en su miserable situacion de no poder eludir la sentencia del tribunal internacional de DDHH.
					
					  Atentar contra la RPDC usando ese destenido paquete de "DDHH" es una gran tonteria igual a tratar de partir una roca a huevazos.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun rechaza la acusacion de EE.UU. en el tema de religion
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun rechaza la acusacion de EE.UU. en el tema de religion
Pyongyang, 4 de noviembre (ATCC) -- En su reciente "informe anual sobre la libertad de religion internacional", el Departamento de Estado de Estados Unidos definio a los 8 paises, incluida la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, como "paises que causan preocupacion especial" censurando a sus caprichos la situacion de la religion en varios paises como si fuera el "inquisidor".
					La acusacion absurda de EE.UU. a la RPDC del supuesto problema religioso es una grave provocacion politica contra la segunda.
					
					Senala asi el diario Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual difundido este miercoles y continua:
					
					Los religiosos coreanos llevan libremente su vida religiosa ejerciendo sin ninguna discriminacion los intocables derechos de ciudadano bajo el regimen socialista al estilo coreano centrado en las masas populares.
					
					Lo consienten y reconocen los miembros de las organizaciones religiosas internacionales, las entidades religiosas y los creyentes de varios paises del mundo que han sido testigos presenciales de esa realidad durante su visita a Corea.
					
					Durante la guerra de agresion contra la RPDC desatada por EE.UU. en la decada de 1950, este exterminador de la religion destruyo mas de mil 900 iglesias, monasterios y templos con indiscriminados bombardeos y asesino a sangre fria a cientos de miles de religiosos inocentes.
					
					La reaccionaria capa gobernante de EE.UU. cuestiona la concepcion y la creencia religiosas, que critican o no aceptan el corrupto modo de vida al estilo norteamericano, y acosa, arresta y asesina a los religiosos descontentos con la politica reaccionaria.
					
					Esta fechoria se comete tambien contra los religiosos extranjeros.
					
					Si bien EE.UU. habla sin cesar del "problema religioso" de la RPDC, su verdadero interes no esta en la vida religiosa de los creyentes sino en utilizar este tema para mellar la imagen de la RPDC y satisfacer la ambicion de aislar y atropellar a esta.
					
					Es tan necio e inutil el intento de atentar contra la muy digna RPDC con esa demagogia. 
					
					Le convendria mas a EE.UU. resolver primero su grave problema religioso que acusar a otro pais que no lo tiene realmente.

articles.title: Se libran en suelo surcoreano ejercicios militares "Hoguk"
articles.content:
Se libran en suelo surcoreano ejercicios militares "Hoguk"
Pyongyang, 4 de noviembre (ATCC) -- Segun fuentes militares, los agresores norteamericanos y los belicistas del ejercito surcoreano libran demencialmente en estos tiempos los ejercicios militares conjuntos "Hoguk" en el suelo, el mar y el cielo del Sur de Corea simulando la guerra de agresion al Norte de Corea.
					En esta maniobra, que durara casi 10 dias desde el 29 de octubre, fueron movilizados las comandancias de operaciones de las fuerzas terrestres, navales y aereas, las flotas y las aviaciones del Sur de Corea y un gran numero de efectivos de las fuerzas navales y aereas norteamericanas estacionadas en el suelo surcoreano y en ultramar y sus equipos belicos.
					
					Los grupos armados del ejercito surcoreano, desplegados en la provincia de Kangwon del Sur de Corea, la de Kyonggi y Seul, efectuan locamente el "entrenamiento combinado contra la penetracion" y ejercitan la ofensiva durante el cruce del rio y  las operaciones de desplazamiento.
					
					Los dragaminas, los buques de desembarco dotados de dique y los destructores provistos de proyectiles teledirigidos de las fuerzas navales norteamericanas, los buques de desembarco y de guerra de la marina surcoreana practicaron en el clima de guerra de verdad el combate naval, la batalla de submarinos, la limpieza de minas en el mar y el desembarco usando como teatro de estas operaciones el Mar Este y el Oeste de Corea.
					
					Los aviones norteamericanos provenientes de sus bases en ultramar como bombarderos estrategicos, cazas bombarderos y aviones de asalto y persecucion, se dedican a los ejercicios de ataque a los blancos importantes, el refuerzo aereo cercano, el despegue y el aterrizaje por la pista de emergencia, el vuelo a larga distancia y el bombardeo en cooperacion con la septima fuerza aerea de EE.UU. enclavada en territorio surcoreano y las aviaciones surcoreanas.
					
					Anteriormente, los belicistas yanquis mandaron al Mar Oeste de la Peninsula Coreana hasta la flotilla de portaaviones nuclear de tamano supergrande "George Washington" para librar en el aire y el mar los provocativos ejercicios conjuntos de guerra en cooperacion con la flota surcoreana.
					
					Todos los hechos demuestran claramente que hoy en dia, el factor amenazante a la Peninsula Coreana no es el "problema nuclear" de alguna parte sino los ejercicios de guerra y la invariable politica hostil que mantienen contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea los imperialistas norteamericanos y los belicistas militares surcoreanos.
